post.body:
It's pretty cool to see how people from around the world pops up in my feed with their localized "Hello ZeroMe!" posts.

Beyond that, if I see a post not in English - you're blocked. English isn't my native tongue either but I don't expect you to put up with endless posts you don't understand... English only until we can filter languages.
I can debate racists, but idiots waste my time.
Anybody know of any dedicated comic book readers on ZN? 1+Gallery (http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PGaLLNiadMzrmw6MMMnpZnskwFcdgZoS4/?!/) contains a lot of cool comics but it's not really suited for reading.
I think I just switched ZeroMe Hub, like intended. But I can't quite believe it was so painless... Something MUST be wrong!

So, this should be my new profile...

http://127.0.0.1:43110/me.zeronetwork.bit/?Profile/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/1DMTYjzfkFHyB8yZ37sMBuTirTUp5bWLQC/saintian@zeroid.bit

comment.body: @Alexum: Come on yourself. Imagine if 50%+ of the posts in your ZeroMe feed was unreadable to you. I'm not stopping anybody from writing in any languages, but I don't think it's fair to demand I see posts in languages I don't understand.

@caryoscelus: 

>But blocking people who happen to post in languages you don't understand locks you out of them on all of 0net, including what they may write in english here or in other places. I don't think that's very smart

In my experience the ratio of interesting posts in the few English posts aren't worth the distraction of a ton of non-readable posts.

>It's like that for everyone who doesn't read chinese. You imagine you're the only one here?

Do I imagine I'm the only non-chinese readinging user on ZeroNet? No.

Do I think it's acceptable that a non-Chinese speaker should get 50%+ Chinese posts in their feed? I don't think so, but anyone is free to think otherwise.

@Ansho Rei: Absolutely lovely! For starters I have to say 1+Gallery is a great zite/system in it self, one of the ZN greats!

The general setup works well, and there's just a few small tweaks needed.

1. When going full screen there should be an option to go fit to width rather than height (and scrollable, ofc.)

2. When pressing space to move down a zoomed in/fullscreen to width-comic book page, the last press shouldn't auto-advance to the next image, just move to the bottom even if it's three pixels. A separate press would be needed to go to the next page.

If you manage to implement those two, I'd say it's a comic book reader! I was thinking about per-gallery bookmarks, but standard browser bookmarks works just fine to pick up where I left off. ðŸ™‚

Advanced features down the road could be 2-pane view (two images side by side) or endless scrolling (all images underneath eachother), tags for galleries (filter by tag:ComicBook or tag:Superheroes), image filters, page turning animation and so on.

@Ansho Rei: Sounds great, I'll be sure to keep a look out for any updates. 

>1+Gallery is not solely focused on comic-books

I know, it works great as a pure image gallery!

>1+Gallery has a tag system, but only the uploaders...

I didn't know, I'll have to check it out.

>In the long term I'll be rebuilding 1+Gallery from scratch

No point implementing too much stuff then. If I get fit to width and space scroll down then next page if at bottom I'm happy! ðŸ˜€
Very cool zite! How does it work, is it streaming from a single machine?
@lavaphox: I'm not all that familiar with the tech side of ZN yet, but it's more of a streaming zite than zite that distributes video ala KopyKate?

@Ansho Rei: The spacebar change helped a lot already, thanks! The normal view zoomed in emulated fit to width gives a much improved experience and I'm looking forward to see if you will implement true fit to width fullscreen.

I have some very minor issues with the spacebar next page, but I'll troubleshoot on my end before reporting any errors.
Decentralization and a bit of crypto?
Now it's just the Chinese, like you and me!
